text: ==History== Osiris NYC 83 shoes The Osiris skateboard video "The Storm" (1999) won the Transworld magazine's readers poll's for best video. A pair of Osiris D3 2001 shoes ==Teams== As of October 2014, the company sponsors team members in skateboarding, BMX, surf, and echelon. ===Osiris D3=== Brian Reid Co. founder of the OSIRIS designed the D3 and D3 2001 with his business partner TONY MAGNUSSON. Brian and Dave Mayhew went shopping after Dave missed a meeting and wanted to endorse a shoe called the GURU. They bought a few shoes some athletic and one hiking boot. This is where the famous large looks were inspired by. Former professional skateboarder Dave Mayhew endorsed the "D3" model, a popular skate shoe.15 Things You Didn't Know About Skate Shoes, Salo, Adam, Skateboarder Magazine. Retrieved on 2006-12-5 The second version of the shoe, the "D3 2001", became very popular and Osiris then released a smaller, lighter, less bulkier version called the "D3 NTX". The "D3 4.0" and a "D3 Snowboarding" boot followed, and both were based on the design of the D3 2001 model. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Shoe companies of the United States Category:Skateboarding companies Category:Shoe brands Category:Companies based in San Diego County, California Category:Clothing companies established in 1996 Category:1990s fashion Category:2000s fashion Category:2010s fashion Category:Skateboard shoe companies
title: Osiris Shoes
